template.name: DPIA Pre-check Assessment
template.description: Quick assessment to determine if a full DPIA is required

questions.question: Does your processing involve systematic monitoring of a publicly accessible area on a large scale?
questions.description: Examples: CCTV surveillance, facial recognition systems in public spaces

questions.question: Are you processing special categories of personal data or data relating to criminal convictions?
questions.description: Special categories: racial/ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs, health data, biometric data, etc.

questions.question: Does your processing involve evaluation or scoring of individuals on a large scale?
questions.description: Examples: credit scoring, profiling, automated decision-making affecting many individuals

questions.question: Are you processing personal data on a large scale?
questions.description: Large scale typically means processing affecting a substantial number of data subjects (1000+ individuals)

questions.question: Does your processing involve innovative technology or novel applications?
questions.description: Examples: AI/ML systems, IoT devices, new tracking technologies, blockchain

questions.question: Could your processing prevent individuals from exercising a right or using a service?
questions.description: Examples: automated decision-making that could deny access to services, employment, or benefits

questions.question: Are you processing personal data of vulnerable individuals?
questions.description: Examples: children under 16, elderly, mentally impaired, employees, patients

questions.question: Does your processing involve matching or combining datasets from different sources?
questions.description: Examples: combining customer data with third-party data, data enrichment, data linking

required.title: DPIA Required
required.description: Based on your answers, a Data Protection Impact Assessment is likely required for your processing activities.
required.recommendation: We strongly recommend conducting a full DPIA before proceeding with your data processing. This will help ensure GDPR compliance and identify potential risks.
next_steps: Consult with your DPO or privacy team
Consider seeking legal advice if needed

recommended.title: DPIA Recommended
recommended.description: While not strictly required, a DPIA would be beneficial for your processing activities.
recommended.recommendation: We recommend conducting a DPIA as a best practice to identify and mitigate potential privacy risks.
next_steps: Monitor for changes that might require a DPIA

not_required.title: DPIA Not Required
not_required.description: Based on your answers, a formal DPIA does not appear to be required for your processing activities.
not_required.recommendation: While a DPIA isn't required, continue to monitor your processing activities for changes that might necessitate one.
